74.heading: Radio City Music Hall.
74.title: "Rosebug"
74.author: Byron Preiss, Tom Sutton
notes: Summary: The janitor at Radio City Music Hall has been killed by a sandbag, and the word "Rosebug" has been written by the victim in the spilled sand. Schlomo, Orsoni Wells, and the FBI arrive to investigate. The FBI says there's a Negro acting as a German spy in the show, and Wells rewrites the script to trick him into revealing himself during the performance His name is Greenwood, and he gets away. Looking for him, Schlomo finds a nest of German spies and hears that they're heading for Washington. With Wells and the FBI, Schlomo heads for Washington. In Washington they apprehend Greenwood pretending to be an ambassador from England. Schlomo doesn't think the case is over, and indeed soon notices that Orsoni Wells' shoes make a footprint that spells "Rosebug." The Wells in Washington is a fake Wells sent by the Germans to bomb a meeting in the Pentagon. Schlomo disarms the bomb and rescues the real Wells.

146.title: Radio Free Hogan's Alley
146.author: Tom Heintjes on comic strips
146.appears_in: p. 18-20 in Hogan's Alley, v. 2, no. 1 (=no. 5) (1998).
notes: Suggests possible focus group responses to classic strips that would have gotten them rejected.

147.title: Radio Free Hogan's Alley
147.author: Tom Heintjes on comic strips
147.appears_in: p. 15-16 in Hogan's Alley, v. 2, no. 2 (=no. 6) (Winter 1999).
notes: Discusses reader polls, and includes a review of A Gallery of Rogues (Ohio State University publication)

148.title: Radio Free Hogan's Alley
148.author: Tom Heintjes on comic strips

149.title: Radio Free Hogan's Alley
149.author: Tom Heintjes
149.appears_in: p. 18-19 in Hogan's Alley, v. 2, no. 4 (=no. 8) (2000).
notes: Reports on the new Annie, being done by Jay Maeder and Andrew Pepoy.

150.title: Radio Free Hogan's Alley
150.author: Tom Heintjes on comic strips
150.appears_in: p. 18-19 in Hogan's Alley, no. 9 (=v. 3, no. 1) (Summer 2001).
notes: Summary: On the re-running of Peanuts strips, and the idea of re-running other old comic strips, an experiment tried for 18 months by the Oakland Press in Michigan. Section on Johnny Hart's controversial Easter Sundy B.C. strips.
